text: for more than 40 years from a little
barbershop in salon in Fort Greene
Brooklyn Jessie Hall has watched the
world shift and move around him while
very little has changed inside his shop
except the prices regular had because
when i first started i think was like a
buck fifty to two dollars and fifty
cents efros was like five six dollars
shades were like two dollars so now it's
moved up where the average haircut now
it starts like seventeen dollars and up
despite the rise in prices loyal
customers keep coming back though tough
economic times have them coming back
less frequently while we still have the
same clients but they get it cut a
little less now instead of people used
to get cut every week or every two weeks
now they want to go for every three
weeks no matter if the shop is packed or
if there's only a single head to cut mr.
Hall continues to hold court mediate
disputes and cutting style hair like
nobody's business I like to see people
happy when they go out and give them a
good haircut they go out smiling in
nineteen-sixty-nine when mr. Hall opened
Jesse's house of stylez things were much
different in this part of Brooklyn a lot
of fighting lot of craziness going on
around the neighborhood and stuff what
uh I guess it would be expected at that
time people wasn't making a lot of money
but you had a lot of underground stuff
going on of all the memories the good
and bad mr. Hall said he looked most
fondly on the sense of family that was
created in his shop I got people that's
been here for 40 years that still come
the children come them currently
grandchildren's and they coming I had a
guy a couple of weeks ago he came in and
he thanked me he said listen man I open
my own shop in Jamaica now it's been
doing well out there it makes me feel
good that somebody listen X people sent
me so where you going to retire you know
I want you to retire I'm glad
around I'm like well it's something me
to do it keep my muscles going so it
keeps me going and keeps me alive you
know you look forward if you don't have
nothing to look forward for I guess
there's no reason to live no more so you
have to do something give back something
that's my thing I'm giving back
something
you
